page.title: 20COLE HENLEY
page.content: There has been a settlement on this site for hundreds of years and it was mentioned in the Domesday book in {1086. { Cole Henley Manor}has a wall containing some{Roman}bricks and the present owners have found{Roman}coins and oyster shells.The farm round the manor has been run and improved for the past thirty years by the late Col. Groves and has now been taken over by his son,Major Groves. The farm house and two of the cottages at{Cole Henley}are{16th century buildings. At{Cole Henley}papers are delivered to the dairy and are put on shelves with the milk to be collected by whoever is allocated the job in each local family.
